lesson_name: Alliances - company bosses on the prowl
good_at: Marcus did well in his assignment task and remembering his animal metaphors from the previous lesson. We discussed around mergers and acquisitions which Marcus has a good grasp of as well as building solid relationships. What was good was how we discussed the difference in cultures between Vietnamese and foreign with regards to work environments and differences such as visiting family homes and joining for dinner in Vietnam. The case study allowed Marcus to show he understood the context and provide examples of how to build relationships such as asking open questions and building rapport using life experiences and things in common.
need_to_improve: As found with other clients, there is a tendency to forget ending sounds such as "s" and "t". Words such as  "herd instinct" needed regular practice to get the correct sound which was achieved after a few tries. His confidence increases once we practice and get the correct sound.

good_at: Marcus has a sound understanding around project management and was able to speak in detail with specific examples. His video assignment was spoken with confidence, with the correct pauses and stress making few errors. Around phrasal verbs he was able to understand the context and then complete the tasks in hand when discussing at length. His business knowledge is good and this comes across when we talk around specific topics such as synonyms and new vocabulary.
need_to_improve: There are some errors around the use of the "s" sound at the end of words when he uses by mistake such as "in my opinions" instead of in my opinion. We went through his video together so he was able to see where he was making mistakes and what needs to be rectified. Around pronounciation, again he needs to practice the "s" sounding words at the end of the word. We will continue to practice regularly to make his speaking pronounciation correct as a habit when he is speaking, there are signs of improvement but may take some time before we see the additional benefits of his speaking exercises.

good_at: Marcus completed the assignment to desired levels and provided a clear viewpoint  regarding advantages and disadvantages of the T5 project. He did well putting the headlines into chronological order and then demonstrated he had remembered the words and phrases from our previous lesson, by being able to use collocations with "take" in sentences. He performed well in role play when asked and was able to perform his roles as senior manager and project managed as expected. His listening skiils are of a good level and this was refelected in the listening exercises. Regarding the case study, his solution was similar to that of what was provided so he was able to complete this task successfully.
need_to_improve: Regular mistakes made around the use of "s" at the end of words, sometimes included and sometimes forgetten. We can go through some pronouncaition exercises next week to help him learn and combat this.

good_at: As with Marcus, Nalisa has a good grasp with her tenses when practicing present perfrect, present simple and present continuous. She has a good base for understanding especially around business but there is much room for growth. Her accent is of a satisfactory level and she is able to speak with a consistent flow and tone at times.
need_to_improve: As with Marcus, specific focus needs to be paid especially around pronounciation. The "th" sound can be problematic but we spent significant time around the sound and how to position the tongue in the correct position when speaking certain "th" words. The "thr" sound is especially difficult and we will need to spend time with regular practice to start seeing significant improvements around this. We will also need to develop the base for basic conversational topics which we did on Wednesday such as travel and countries she would like to go on holiday.

good_at: Nalisa was able to distinguish the difference between ever and never with the correct use of when to use in the correct context. Her ability to remember words and the use of present perfect is of a decent standard. She was able to grasp the health aspects and then reiterate stories based on information shared by the teacher. I can already see improvement with her practice of the "th" sound which is good to see and she is motivated to keep on learning and building her English skills. She was able to discuss about traditional remedies using specific examples such as "congee".
need_to_improve: There is room to improve learning words for parts of the body such as "wrist" so she can broaden her vocabulary when discussing health matters. Words such as "stomach" need practice to get the correct pronounciation as were often spoken incorrectly. Another point to be aware of is the ending sound of "s". For example "old wives" was spoken without the correct ending so we practiced a few times to get the correct sound. I also sent Nalisa some useful exercises for her to practice with specific focus on the "s" and "ed" ending sounds. I recommended her to record her voice and check pronounciation against the words she is attempting to say to ensure she is speaking correctly and that she can see her own improvement.

good_at: Nalisa was able to clearly understand the difference between "for and since" by using specific examples of her as a mother. She was able to read and understand the timeline at depth when questioned and also portray her own timeline when we discussed together.  There has been significant improvement with her "sh" and "th", "thr" sounds which is good to see. She has no issue with the "sh" and "ch" sounds, also the "k" and "g" sounds
need_to_improve: We practiced a lot with words ending in "s". There is a common habit to forget pronouncing this sound at the end of words when speaking. With regular practice we can improve the pronounciation with words ending in "s" when speaking at length. There is also some issue with words ending with "ed" and this will also improve with regular practice using the examples that I have provided for her.

lesson_name: I have spent all my salary
good_at: Nalisa can talk about spending and saving money with full understanding, we used several examples during discussion which she was able to comprehend, especially during the listening part. Her present perfect skills are of a good level and she had no issue using just, already and yet in the correct context. She was able to talk about shopping aspects in depth, such as buying a house and taking a loan from the back. She was also quite confident when speaking and pronouncing the "pr" sounds which she requested some assistance with.
need_to_improve: Regular practice for the "sh" sound with specific focus on the pronounciation and some speaking exercises with the tongue twisters. Needs to continue practicing the "s" and "ed" sounds at the end of words to improve her mastery, continually showing signs of improvement on a weekly basis.
